title: Käthe Sasso
content: Käthe Sasso (Austrian German pronunciation: [ˈkɛːtə ˈsaso]; née Smudits; March 1926 – 14 April 2024) was an Austrian child resistance activist during World War II. As a concentration camp and death march survivor, she wrote several works that chronicle her experiences during Nazi rule in Germany.[1][2][3]
